page.title: 01The Landscape (1)
page.content: Five parishes meet in this mainly flat agricultural area:{West Chiltington, {Pulborough, Billingshurst, Shipley}and {Thakeham.}In the centre is the hamlet of{Broadford Bridge; Coolham}village lies beyond the northeast. The highest point is 146ft in the northwest. This is real Wealden farming country on lush grassland. Most of the farms have small pedigree herds of dairy or beef cattle. Oak trees and hedges line every road, track and field, and are the dominant features of the area, together with many fine farmhouses and barns dating from the 15th century. Small woods and coppices are almost entirely deciduous. A line of springs runs out where the Lower Greensand ridge in the south meets the heavy clay, and streams or ditches criss- cross the area. There are no schools, churches, or shops in this area.
